author: tatzmiki
title: Indigo NFT for Sustainable Fashion
description: As pessoas não têm idéia de onde vêm as cores usadas em suas roupas e de que são feitas, e isso é um problema sério para todos.

f6_assessments.q0:
I think I am competent to assess this proposal as I have been active in project Catalyst since fund 4 and I have experience analyzing business requirements from over 5 years of delivering software solutions for small business and corporations as well.
The problem statement is clearly formulated, but not very gripping. Is it really a problem that people don't know what the dyes used for their clothing are? It would have been useful to hear an explanation why this is concerning.
The solution is formulated clearly as well, but it needed to be expanded on in the detailed plan, so that we know how said NFT's would be linked to the clothing. I imagine you'd have to enter a partnership with a certain brand first of all. Then there's the question of how you would get the NFT. Maybe a QR code when buying the item? The problem then is that most people aren't involved in crypto, so they don't have a wallet. Would it not just be simpler to have this information written on a label when you buy the item? I fail to see why a complicated solution like an NFT partnership with a brand would be required here. If there is a reason, then it should have been present in the detailed plan, which is missing. Due to this and the fact that the proposal fails to specify any KPI's as well, I strongly disagree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer has only added a link to an instagram page with pictures of dyes. Unfortunately, this information does not prove the proposer has the technical skills in order to accomplish the task here, nor does the proposal give any details if there would be other people working on this. It would have been good to have a LinkedIn page, or a website with more information about the proposer.
Due to the missing information that I mentioned above, as well as no breakdown of the budget or details on how it will be allocated, no risk analysis and no plan outlining the technical approach, I have to disagree that this proposal can be implemented successfully. Please note that this is all crucial information that you need to add to a proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: I strongly disagree that the information here is sufficient for this proposal to be auditable, or very clear to understand. While it specified clearly what it wants to do, it needed to give more details on how it would do this. A roadmap with specific milestones and KPI's would have been of great help for this purpose.

f6_assessments.q0: I'm not sure what the proposer means by "colors", it is unclear wheather this is a reference to the color dye used in the clothing? Could you elaborate on why this is unsustainable so voters understand why this issue is important?
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer appears from their social media profile to be an experience dye artist. This proposal seems to not have a real idea of the technical side to creating NFTs, and how they will be tracked along during the lengthy logistics supply chain. If that is not the case, then this proposal could still be improved greatly by including a rough idea of how this NFT which will follow the dye through the supply chain.
f6_assessments.q2:
This proposal also lacks a roadmap and really doesn't seem to have a clear plan to reach the stated goal of creating NFTs to track dyes through the supply chain, which is actually a non-trivial problem based on my own previous blockchain experience advising supply chain protocols.

I think that the proposer should plan out a real roadmap with milestones at 3, 6 and 12 months, and include specific KPIs for each of those milestones. That would go a very long way in increasing the audibility of this proposal, and increase the likelihood of getting funding!

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal does not address the main objectives of the challenge. The problem statement is irrelevant to the challenge and there is no clear explanation on how the solution can help address the challenge. The team does not provide details on the background problem statement as well as the proposed solution. This proposal looks like unfinished and therefore should not be funded.
f6_assessments.q1: The team does mention relevant experience in the proposal but it lacks the evidences to back up the claim. The incomplete proposal makes it hard for community to ensure the continuation and success of this project. The team requested a budget without detail on how the money will be spend or allocated. It is surprising this proposal is pass for assessment given there is no roadmap, budget breakdown, or timeline for the execution of this project in the proposal. My suggestion for the team is to update the proposal with more information and details.
f6_assessments.q2: There are no clear success metrics or KPI in the proposal. The team does not provide deliverables, roadmap, or detailed plan on how to execute the project and there is no budget breakdown in the proposal. Team does not mention where they will publish the progress of project execution making it impossible to trace, monitor, or audit the project. My suggestion for the team is to update the proposal with more information and details including deliverables, goals, KPI, roadmap, detailed execution plan, and budget breakdown.

f6_assessments.q2: It is not easy to assess a proposal that is incomplete like this one where auditability/transparency can't be guaranteed. Therefore, based on the given information, I strongly disagree with this proposal's auditability, and would give it a score of 1.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem is shortly presented, quite clear, but it may not be everyone's problem as it is announced. The solution remains very abstract as "a new type of NFT". 
The proposal should explain more the reason why the origins of the color are important to everyone or a group of them, for example, some people have an allergy to artificial dye, etc.
